hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.util

Class MatrixPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix.util.MatrixPrinter

  • public class MatrixPrinter
extends Object
    Utility class for displaying matrices. The layout can be fine-tuned using a MatrixPrinter.Control instance. If a control is not supplied as an argument, the default control parameters are used. See the documentation of the Control class for the defaults.

    The format of the matrix elements can also be specified; they can be converted to string using the default canonical Double.toString(double), a supplied NumberFormat instance, or a format string. (Note: due to a bug in Java versions prior to 7, results of format strings are not localized when the "%e" or "%g" conversion is used.)

    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

      Enumeration defining possible values for horizontal alignment of matrix elements.

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m)
        Prints the matrix to the standard output using default control arguments. The matrix elements are converted to string using Double.toString(double) resulting in a locale-independent canonical form.

        An invocation of this method of the form print(m) behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation 

             print(m, new Control())
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if m is null

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         String format)
        Prints the matrix to the standard output using default control arguments. The matrix elements are formatted using the specified format string and the default locale. The format string is expected to receive a single argument of type double.

        An invocation of this method of the form print(m, f) behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation 

             print(m, new Control(), f, Locale.getDefault())
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        format - the format string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null
        IllegalFormatException - if the format string is incorrect

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         String format,
         Locale locale)
        Prints the matrix to the standard output using default control arguments. The matrix elements are formatted using the specified format string and the specified locale. The format string is expected to receive a single argument of type double. If locale is null, then no localization is applied.

        An invocation of this method of the form print(m, f, l) behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation 

             print(m, new Control(), f, l)
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        format - the format string
        locale - the locale to use; if it is null, then no localization is applied
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the matrix or the format is null
        IllegalFormatException - if the format string is incorrect

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         MatrixPrinter.Control control,
         String format,
         Locale locale)
        Prints the matrix as specified by the supplied Control instance. The matrix elements are formatted using the specified format string and locale. The format string is expected to receive a single argument of type double. If locale is null then no localization is applied.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        control - the control instance specifying the destination and format-related parameters
        format - the format string
        locale - the locale to apply; if it is null, then no localization is performed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the matrix, control, or format string is null
        IllegalFormatException - if the format string is incorrect

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         MatrixPrinter.Control control)
        Prints the matrix as specified by the supplied Control using canonical number format. The matrix elements are converted to string using Double.toString(double) resulting in a locale-independent canonical form.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        control - the control instance specifying the destination and format-related parameters
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         NumberFormat format)
        Prints the matrix using default control arguments. The matrix elements are formatted using the specified NumberFormat.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        format - the NumberFormat used to convert the matrix elements to string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null

      • print

        public static void print(Matrix m,
         MatrixPrinter.Control control,
         NumberFormat format)
        Prints the matrix as specified by the supplied Control instance. The matrix elements are formatted using the specified NumberFormat.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        control - the Control instance to use
        format - the NumberFormat used to convert the matrix elements to string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either argument is null

      • printCode

        public static void printCode(Matrix m)
        Prints the matrix to the standard output, producing an array representation that can be used to recreate the matrix with MatrixFactory.createMatrix(double[][]) or MatrixFactory.createVector(double[]). This method is intended for debugging.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to print
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
